fullText: The songs, by the Avett Brothers, are lovely, but the musical lacks the dramatic architecture to support them effectively.
dtliExcerpt: The songs, by the Avett Brothers, are lovely, but the musical lacks the dramatic architecture to support them effectively.
bwwExcerpt: You may nevertheless want to ask yourself whether a show whose sound effects include amplified vomit is right for you. For all its hornpipes and full-throated song, its visual panache and masculine eye candy, “Swept Away,” is among the darkest, most unsparing musicals ever to anchor itself on Broadway. And despite the suggestion of rapture in its title, it is really about the gravest decisions humans can make, the depths of souls that are darker than the sea’s.
